result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarell J Valentine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jarell J Valentine is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jarell J Valentine was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with any person involved in using or trafficking illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Complete any assessment PO deems necessary by applying the Risk & Needs evaluation and comply with any treatment recommendation

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay Court Costs/Fees on both cases 15CF867 and 16CF45 as a condition of probation.  15CF867 is to be paid first 

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 67 days if probation is ever revoked (time remaining between the 9 months with good time calculated)

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
No Contact with the victim unless approved by the DOC
.

The DOC is to use the Risk & Needs evaluation to determine what additional assessments, evaluations, or programs are appropriate.  Defendant is to follow-through with any recommendations made

Pay Court costs/fees as originally ordered

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

- Extended Supervision is 2 yrs w/ conditions:  DOC to use Risk & Needs evaluation to detemine what add'l assessments or evaluations are approp - def is to comply w/ any recommendations made;  No Contact w/ victim unless approved by the DOC;  Pay CC as originally ordered;  Pay DOC fees

From: Pastor Candalania Cole Re: take house arrest ankle bracelet into consideration
SLH: CC: DA response
From: PO Jacob Hinrichs Re: review hearing

8:45 AM - Def in court, in custody.  Justine L Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Def: am comfortable going ahead today w/o counsel. SULESKI: to blame that on the DOC is ridiculous. CRT: you could easily go to prison at this point. 5 mos into probatino you haven't reported and they would be in their rights to revoke your probation but they are willing to work w/ you. You were given the chance on probation and if you don't address your issues, you will go to prison and b/c this is assaultive in nature, you can rest assured that it will not be a short prison sentence. 
CRT: def to serve 30 days CJ  with  13 days credit. To be served w/o release

State by Suleski /  Def in custody w/ Atty Michael Yang
Suleski:  Both parties had every intention of having plea ready to go - this morning Atty Yang stopped by & had some concerns about Fel BJ & felt no basis for it - I inherited this case from Vasupuram & I need to look into it.  We're very close - looking for another plea date & ask that it be removed from trial calendar
CRT:  I will not remove from trial calendar - he's been in custody for a year - if you have a plea agreement next week we'll do the plea but I will not continue trial for more plea negotiations.  Get new date & time w/ my JA

P, in custody, w/Atty Yang - Court: $1,000 cash bond to cover this file & 15CF867 & 15CM1064 w/conditions - No contact w/VW or her children, curfew 10 pm-6am, Comply w/JSS including GPS, curfew & exclusion zone

Yang - asking for reduction in bond, possibility the first felony is going to trial
